result.execSummary:
The defendant Christy L Scheiber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Ms. Scheiber   to  14  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  9  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being
Consecutive to: Any Sentence in Being

superMiscConds.notes: --$150 in restitution payable to Judith Ludwig

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent

--take all prescription medications as prescribed by treating physician

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY : Watertown PD
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision
Consecutive to: Any sentence in being

[MA]Case called at 1:41pm 
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ has no factual corrections to the PSI
Atty. Hunt makes some factual corrections to the PSI

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
--DA Happ submits victim impact statements
recess: 2:18pm--reconvene: 2:24pm
Statements made members of victims family
--State's Sentencing Exhs #1(surveillance video of victim) and #2(photo collage of victim)

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Hunt
Statement made by Ms. Scheiber

The Court makes inquiry of Det Srgt Gray who is present in the courtroom gallery

The Court sentences Ms. Scheiber   to  14  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  9  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   4  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription medications as prescribed by treating physician
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--$150 in restitution payable to Judith Ludwig
--$442 Subpoena fees
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory costs

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:45pm
Letter to the Court  from John Scheiber in support of Christy Scheiber

Criminal Case Settlement
Sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:08am. 
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.  DA Susan Happ and ADA Monica Hall appear for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Ms. Scheiber, verifying that she understands and joins in the agreement.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; the maximum fine-amount is recited; a plea of "  No Contest " is entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Scheiber guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On request of DA Happ, the Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation.  
The Court revokes Bond.  
recess 10:18am.

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing in early February (one to three weeks after the the filing of the PSI report is anticipated), allow three hours; the Defense requests that an afternoon hearing time be set

Motion to Allow Admission of Other Acts Evidence  John Schroeder - State's
NOTICE OF INTENT TO ADMIT STATEMENTS MADE BY THE DEFENDANT TO GEORGETTE SWENSON AND PAUL MILLER - STATE'S

[MK] case called at 1:46pm. 
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.  ADA Monica Hall and DA Susan Happ appear for the State of Wisconsin [DA Happ later exited the hearing at 4:16pm.]
Attorney Hunt acknowledges that his legal issue-research has shown that the burden of proof on Daubert is on the proponent. Attorney Hunt indicates that the Defense has no additional information to submit on the Defense Expert Witness James Oehldrich. 
The Court will not allow the final conclusion in the Report of the Defense Expert Witness that, "... but for the Oxycodone, that Mr. Sterwald took after his last dose of Heroin, Mr. Sterwald would not have died."
The Court orders that this last line of the Report will be excluded as not being in the area of expertise of the Defense expert. The other two subject opinions are allowed as being in the area of expertise for that witness. 

After hearing arguments on the opinions in the expert report in Motion paragraphs 3 and 4, the Court concludes that the Defense has not met the burden to allow the opinion (paragraph 3) on the amount of morphine in the urine as it relates to heroin use on multiple occasions, and the opinion (paragraph 4) on the lack of 6-Monoacetylmorphine in the blood; these two opinions will not be allowed because the Defense has not shown that these opinions are based on reliable principals and methods. 

After hearing arguments on the opinion in the expert report in Motion paragraph 5 regarding the lack of oxycodone in the urine, the Court concludes that the opinion will not be allowed for the reason that it is not based on accurate information; the undisputed fact is that the victim's urine was not tested for oxycodone, so the opinion is based on insufficient or incorrect facts.  The last two sentences in paragraph 5 and the first sentence in paragraph are excluded. 

At the request of Attorney Hunt the Court clarifies that the Court will allow the expert give the opinion that if Mr. Sterwald had used Oxycodone three hours before his death, there would have been oxycodone in his urine. The Court notes that the State has not asked for exclusion of this sentence. 

Attorney Hunt requests the opportunity to give a brief offer-of-proof at trial, when the expert witness is present, as to the paragraph 3,4, and 5 rulings.  
The Court will allow for this opportunity if this Defense believes they can demonstrate that there are reliable principals and methods underlying the 3 & 4 opinions. The Court alerts Attorney Hunt that there may be a notice-issue related to this from the State.  
-----------------------------------------------------
The Court hears arguments on the Defendant's 9/30/16 Motion to Exclude the Testimony of Purported Expert Detective Sergeant Gray
Det. Sgt. Margareta Gray- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
The Court determines that Detective Sergeant Gray may give the opinion testimony as set forth in the State's Notice.  The Court finds that Detective Sergeant Gray's testimony given today does support the conclusion that her opinions are based on reliable principals and methods.  
The Court denies the Defense Motion to Exclude the testimony of Detective Sergeant Gray. 
------------------------------------------------------
The Court hears arguments on the Defendant's 10/3/16 Amended Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony of Dr. Brian Peterson as Impermissible Surrogate Testimony. 
ADA Hall clarifies that Dr. Peterson is going to give his own opinions related to his review of the case; Dr. Peterson is aware that he is not allowed, in any way, to relay the opinions of Dr. Rogalska. 
Based on the Griep case law, the Court allows the testimony of Dr. Peterson on his independant opinions; Dr. Peterson is allowed to rely upon the reports of Dr. Roglaska and of the toxicologist.    
------------------------------------------------------
The Court hears arguments on the State's Motion for Reconsideration; the Defendant's Motion Exhibit #1 and State's Motion Exhibit #2 copies of text messages are received.   The Court maintains its prior ruling that the text messages from Mr. Beverly and Ms. Cahoon are admissible.  
----------------------------------------------------

The Court addresses procedural matters related to the Jury Trial: 
--the Court intends to carry two additional jurors; each party will have five strikes during peremptory challenges
--the jurors should be ready to begin the jury selection process at 9:00am on the first morning of trial
--the Court will allow the Jurors to take notes and to ask written questions of witnesses  
--counsel agree that the trial length will be five days; ADA Hall indicates that the State anticipates completing its case in chief by end of day on Wednesday; Attorney Hunt believes the Defense case can be completed within two days  
--in response to the Court's inquiry, Attorney Hunt indicates that there is no need for a Miranda-Goodchild hearing 
--the Court extends the time for any case negotiations to Friday November 18th at noon; Attorney Hunt is to notify the Court of any intended change-of-plea by that afternoon so that a writ can be issued for a plea hearing to occur on November 22nd or November 23rd.
Reconvene 5:05pm 
[Post Hearing/Off-Record: the Court reminds Attorney Hunt that the Defense will need to make arrangements for Ms. Scheiber to have street clothes to wear during the Jury Trial.] 

NEXT:  Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar to commence on 11/28/16 for a five day length
Defense

Case called at 1:40pm [MA]
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.  DA Susan Happ and ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel verify readiness for Trial


On State's Motion to Reconsider Ruling on Suicide Evidence:
--arguments given by DA Happ
--questioning by the Court

Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. Hunt indicates the Defense objects to the State's Motion to Reconsider; gives basis.
The Court determines that probative value vs. unfair prejudice was not addressed previously

The Court grants the State's Motion for procedural purposes.

--arguments given by Atty. Hunt
--the Court questions Atty. Hunt as to what information/evidence intends to introduce as to suicide/suicide attempts

The Court finds that homicide and suicide are not mutually exclusive in this case.

--further arguments by Counsel; questioning by the Court

DA Happ cites page 16 from Transcript of 2/1/16 Motion Hearing.
The Court and Counsel review the Elements of the Charge.

The Court determines that the suicide information is not highly probative; high risk of unfair prejudice
The Court determines that there will not be mention of suicide in front of Jury or in any matter.

recess: 3:15pm--reconvene: 
[off record: Atty. Hunt updates his mailing address to 342 N. Water St. Suite 600, Milwaukee, WI 53202; files a Notice of Appearance for co- counsel Jeff Nichols]

As to the Notice of Appearance:
--no objection from DA Happ
--agreed to by Ms. Scheiber

On State's Second Motion to Allow Introduction and Admission of Other Acts Evidence:
--arguments given by DA Happ
--argument in objection given by Atty. Hunt

--the Court finds is being offered for proper purpose; intent and knowledge
--the Court finds that there is relevance
--the Court finds the evidence is highly probative

The Court limits the time frame to 2  months prior to date of violation to date of violation, limited to discussion re: Heroin

The Court grants the motion except for other acts that occurred post date of violation. 

DA Happ indicates that the State will be filing a Daubert Motion; challenging Defense's witness testimony
--Atty. Hunt opposed to a Daubert Motion
--the Court determnes that It will not hear arguments until Motion(s) are filed, which are to be filed by 9/30/16, it is the responsibility of the filing party to schedule the Motion hearing prior the the FSSC.

[MK] case called at 2:29pm. 
Attorney Edward J. Hunt in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Final Status/Scheduling Conference and for Motion Hearing today, however the Court has learned that the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office did not transport Defendant Christy Scheiber on the Writ for today's hearing. The Court directs DA Happ to follow up on how an error occurred with this.  
The Court indicates that it will not be discussing any matters of substance today because Ms. Scheiber is absent; only scheduling matters will be addressed.
The Court notes that it did meet with counsel in Chambers, with the Court Reporter present, to privately discuss medical issues related to Attorney Hunt; this was done on the Record. The Court directs Attorney Hunt to inform Ms. Scheiber of the discussion that was held in Chambers today. 
The Court reschedules today's hearing to June 28th.  DA Happ will ensure that the Writ for this new date is prepared today.  
recess 2:39pm.  

NEXT:  Rescheduled FSSC and Motion Hearing on Tuesday, June 28th at 8:30am.

Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in-custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt (15CF97). Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in-custody, with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides (15CF99). ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES:
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Defendant Stands Mute; Plea of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf

15CF97: On Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing:
Statements by John Scheiber; Statements by John Allen Scheiber
Arguments by Counsel
Court presents basis and forfeits $7500 of the bond and orders the $5000 to be returned to surety
ADA Hall renews requests that the monies forfeited be given to victims to pay for funeral expenses; arguments presented by counsel
Atty Benavides exits from 2:06 - 2:09 pm 
Court informs parties that It will hold a hearing on recompense - with notice to intereseted government agency. Court informs Counsel that they are not required to appear for this hearing.
Recess as to 15CF97: 2:10 pm - Atty Hunt exits

15CF99: On Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies motion for bond modification
Recess: 2:22 pm

Cases 15CF97 and 15CF99 called together at 8:31am [mo]
Co- Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody with Attorney Edward J. Hunt. Co-Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Benavides.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.

Attorney Hunt requests sequestration of witnesses. DA Happ notes that there is only one witness. The Court grants the request, in the event that another witness would enter the courtroom  

Detective Jonathan Caulcutt -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Happ  
--State's exh. #1 (Report from Milwaukee Co. Assistant Medical Examiner, Dr. Rogalska)received
--State's exh. #2 (Included with Report from Milwaukee Co. Medical Examiner, identify victim and cause of death)received 
--cross examination by Attorney Benavides 
--cross examination by Attorney Hunt

Argument given by Attorney Benavides
Argument given by Attorney Hunt

The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Scheiber committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Miller committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

The Court reviews and recites the statue regarding 'reckless homicide' 
The Court gives reasoning for finding probable cause and reviews the exhibits submitted by the State.

Attorney Hunt submits a Substitution of Judge Request
Attorney Benavides submits a Substitution of Judge Request
The Court grants both requests for Substitution of Judge 

Case 15CF99, As to Defendant's 5/12/15 Motion for Bail Modification:
--Attorney Benavides withdraws the Motion at this time. 
recess: 11:02am

Case called at 10:54 am [Clerk SH] (On Motion to Forfeit Bond & for Additional Cash Bond)
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in-custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified by DA Happ; Court so finds
Atty Hunt confirms receipt of motion & new complaint in 15CF123, prepared to proceed

On Motion to Forfeit Bond:
Arguments by DA Happ in support of motion - requests forfeiture be applied to funeral expenses, submits expenses
Arguments by Atty Hunt in opposition of motion, reviews 969.132(2)
Rebuttal argument by DA Happ
Court indicates that due to statutory the language "shall" and Its findings that the bond has not been complied with (probable cause in 15CF123); The Court finds the bond to be in default and orders the entire amount forfeited. The Court declines to set aside order in lieu of other conditions. 

On Motion for Additional Cash Bond:
Arguments by Atty Hunt 

Court requires a $25,000 cash bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Paul Miller
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No possession of any needles needed unless prescribed
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Not leave State of Wisconsin
-Submit to daily urinalyses at Jefferson County Jail at 6:00 pm
-Take all prescription medications as prescribed
Recess: 11:49 am
